verses.plain: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.

tokens.t: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.

verses.plain: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: when shall I come and appear before God?

tokens.t: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: when shall I come and appear before God?

verses.plain: My tears have been my meat day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where is thy God?

tokens.t: My tears have been my meat day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where
thy God?

verses.plain: When I remember these things, I pour out my soul in me: for I had gone with the multitude, I went with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with a multitude that kept holyday.

tokens.t: When I remember these
, I pour out my soul in me: for I had gone with the multitude, I went with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with a multitude that kept holyday.

verses.plain: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him for the help of his countenance.

tokens.t: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and
art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him
the help of his countenance.

verses.plain: O my God, my soul is cast down within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermonites, from the hill Mizar.

tokens.t: O my God, my soul is cast down within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermonites, from the hill Mizar.

verses.plain: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.

tokens.t: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.

verses.plain: Yet the LORD will command his lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night his song shall be with me, and my prayer unto the God of my life.

tokens.t: the
will command his lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night his song
with me,
my prayer unto the God of my life.

verses.plain: I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

tokens.t: I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

verses.plain: As with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where is thy God?

tokens.t: with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where
thy God?

verses.plain: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.

tokens.t: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him,
the health of my countenance, and my God.

footnotes.text: Maschil…: or, A Psalm giving instruction of the sons, etc
for the…: or, his presence is salvation
the hill…: or, the little hill
